titleInfo.title: James V. Martin House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1870. It is a two story frame with side gables and rear ell with front-gabled porch. Structure was built from I-house plan with elaborate Eastlake-influenced decoration and is one of the most intact and decorative I-house forms in the rural area of the county. It is located at 545 Martin Valley Rd., Walland TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Lamar Memorial Library

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1888. It was built from brick in form of Greek cross with oak interior woodwork. Structure was built as a memorial to Professor Thomas Jefferson Lamar, the college's "second founder." It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Center for Campus Ministry

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Aluminum Company of America House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1920. It is a one story frame house with front and rear gables and an interior central chimney. Structure is a typical "company house" for laborers. It is located at 1415 Dalton St., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Samuel A. Patton Building

mods.abstract: Structure was built ca. 1875. It was built in Italianate style from brick with tin roof. Structure is a department and jewelry store. It is located at 114 E. Broadway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Commercial

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John Russell House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1851. It is two story, double pile, five bay, central passage plan. Structure is a Brick I-House. It is located at Prater Rd. off Old Lowes Ferry Rd., at Poland Creek, Louisville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Unoccupied

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Carnegie Hall

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1916. It was designed by Knoxville architect R. F. Graf in Georgian Colonial style built of tan brick. It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Student residence hall

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Blount County Courthouse

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1907. It is built in Greek Revival style with Ionic columns supporting a full entablature and cupola. It was built of yellow brick. It was the seat of county government. It is located at 341 Court St., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: County; Current Use: Same

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Marcus B. Warren House

mods.abstract: Structure built in between 1874 and 1877. Structure features a gable front design with a flat deck roof. It is located at Miser Station Rd.,0..2 mi. S. of Middle settlements Rd., Louisville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Will Caldwell House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1914. It is a two story frame house in Craftsman style. It is located at 138 Stanley Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Peery Mill Site

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1842. It is a mill site and location of Peery Brothers Mill after 1905. It operated as a tourist attraction in the late 1980s when it burned. Only the dam remains. It is located at Old Walland Hwy, 0.1 mi. N of Cold Springs Rd. Walland TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: None

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
A. G. Howe House later known as "Casablanca"

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1870. It is a two story frame house with side gables. It originally had two front entrances. It is located at 400 Indiana Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Dr. Leland Ramsey House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1885. It is a one story frame house with gabled roof, rear ell, gabled front porch with decorative wood trim. It is located at 317 W. Broadway Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Smokehouse

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1700. It is a smokehouse relocated to site of Cable Mill by Park Service. It is a log pen structure with front and rear gables, half dovetail notches, and poplar logs. It has a poplar log meat bench inside. It is located in Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Andy Dunn House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1800. It is a one and one-half story frame house with hip and gable roof, dormers, and porch. It is located at 2410 Sevierville Rd., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Macklin Kerr House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1847. It is a two story brick with frame side and rear additions. It is a site of Gen. O. O. Howard's headquarters during the Federal Army's visit to Blount County in December, 1863. It is located at Big Gully Rd., 0.3 mi. N. of Kyker Rd., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Jasper Converse Barnes House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1896. It is has a two story frame with hip and gable roof. It is built in Queen Anne style. It is located at 116 Indiana Avenue, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Thompson Bridge (over Nine Mile Creek)

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1915. It is a closed spandrel concrete bridge. It is one of relatively few remaining from Blount County's early 20th century road and bridge-building effort. It is located at Thompson Bridge Rd. at Lanier Rd., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: County; Current Use: Same

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Cam Walker Barn

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1890. It is a double pen log barn with frame additions. It is located at Walker Rd., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Barn

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John Hackney House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1850. It is built from unusual four room plan with four connected linear rooms each originally having an outside as well as an inside entrance. John Hackney operated a saw and grist mill on Gallahar's Creek in the 19th century. Pat Stinnett, who owned the house in the early 20th century, operated a local quarry. It is located at Front St. and Big Springs Rd.,, Friendsville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Cades Cove Primitive Baptist Church

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1887. It is a one room frame church with front and rear gables and front belfry. It was built to replace earlier log church and cemetery. It is located in Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum, with occasional use as a church

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Walland Depot

mods.abstract: This structure is built ca. 1901. It is a typical hip-roofed depot. It served as terminus for both the Knoxville & Augusta Railroad (later Southern Railroad) and the Little River Railroad. It is located on Hwy 321, Walland, later relocated to Hwy 321, Townsend.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Since 1982, Little River Railroad and Lumber Company Museum

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Happy Valley School

mods.abstract: Structure was built in 1936. It is a brick, colonial revival style built by the Works Projects Association (WPA). It is a remaining example of Blount County schools in that era. It is located at Happy Valley Rd., Tallassee, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: County;

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
William Dunn Stone Fence

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1700. It was built by William Dunn or Mr. Snyder. The stone fence is several hundred yards in length, 3-4 feet high, and 2-3 feet wide. It is located at Schoolhouse Gap Rd, Dry Valley, Townsend, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Private

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Sam Houston Schoolhouse

mods.abstract: Structure was built in 1794. It is a log building, reconstructed in the 1970s. Sam Houston taught here in 1812 before moving on to military and political careers. It is located at 3650 Old Sam Houston School Rd..
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: State; Current Use: State historic site, including the schoolhouse, a museum and gift shop, a pavilion

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John P. Cable Mill

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1800. It is a frame grist mill powered by overshot water wheel. Exterior of mill rebuilt by Park Service in 1951. Wheel has been replaced several times. It is located in Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Operating mill for display

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Chilhowee Inn

mods.abstract: This structure is a two story frame hotel with gable roof built by Schlosser Leather Company for lodging and food service. Named by Mrs. Jack Fisher, wife of the plant manager, it continued to operate long after the company closed in 1931. It is located at Old Walland Hwy.,Walland, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Charles M. Hall School

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1926. It is a one story brick school with hip and gable roof. Originally a segregated school, later integrated and called Alcoa Middle School. It ceased to be a school in 2002 and sold to private developers. It is located at 229 E. Watt St., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Alcoa City Center

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Alumni Gymnasium

mods.abstract: Structure was built in 1923. It is one of few surviving frame gymnasiums built as a project of Maryville College alumni. It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Sport Facility

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Bill and Joe Walker House

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1700. It is a two story brick and frame house with hip roof. It is located at Singleton Station Rd., Rockford, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Eusebia Presbyterian Church

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1930. It is built from brick. Congregation organized in 1786. Eusebia is believed to be the oldest congregation in the area. It is located on Sevierville Rd.(Hwy 411) at Burnett Sta. Rd. Seymour, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Church

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Harper Brothers Store and Post Office

mods.abstract: Structure built as early as 1860 with later additions. It is a typical false-front, frame general store. Son of one of the proprietors, John Harper, became president of the Aluminum Company of America. It is located at Cox Rd., Louisville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Unoccupied

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Samuel E. Dunn House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1890. It is a two story frame with hip roof and Classical Revival columns. It is located at 903 Court St., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Margaret Townsend Memorial Methodist Church

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1924. It is a frame church with gable roof built by Little River Lumber Company as a memorial to the wife of the company's president. It is located at 7719 River Rd., Townsend, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: St. Francis Catholic Church

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Dr. Carson House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1940s. It is one and one-half story frame bungalow with front and rear gables. It is boyhood residence of Tennessee Governor and US Senator Lamar Alexander. It is located at 121 S. Ruth St., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Meadhaven or Jarad Mead House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1877. It is a two story frame house with side ells, gable and hip roof. This Italianate structure encloses an earlier small house. It is located at Cox Rd., Louisville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Harper Memorial Library

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1917. It is Colonial Revival style and built of brick. Structure was city of Maryville's Public Library, then Blount County's Public Library 1930-1981. It is located at 300 E. Church St., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Red Cross

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Goddard Cottage

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1700. It is a one story frame house in Carpenter Gothic style. It is located off Main St. in Louisville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Anderson Hall

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1869-1870. It housed administration for college of liberal arts which pioneered higher education for some populations. A rear addition was constructed in 1890 with brick. It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Classrooms and offices

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Doctors Hospital

mods.abstract: Structure dated from 1900s. It is a two story frame and brick building with hip and gable roof. It functioned as Doctors Hospital from 1943 to 1949. It is located at the corner of Ellis Ave. & College St., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Offices

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Samuel Frazier House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1795. It is a two story, three bay house built of rough quarried marble. Its "Penn Plan" design of three rooms is unusual in the county. It is one of the county's oldest houses. It is located at 4702 Big Springs Rd, Greenback.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Minnis McCampbell Barn

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1910. It is a cantilevered double pen log barn with square notches and oak logs. It is located on Old Cades Cove Rd., 0.1 mi. S of Dry Valley Rd., Townsend, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Barn

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Elijah Oliver House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1840. It is one and one-half story double pen log house with dogtrot separating front and rear pens. The front pen has V notches, and the rear has half dovetail notches. The front pen was built in 1870s by Elijah Oliver, and the rear pen was built in the 1840s by the Herron family. It is located in Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
David Jones House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1880s. It is built in a distinctive Second Empire style built from brick. It is the home of David Jones, skilled mason and contractor who, in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, built a number of buildings in Maryville. He was also the owner of a brickyard. It is located at 721 E. Lamar Alexander Pkwy, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Highland Presbyterian Church's education and social building

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Jim Hatcher Barn

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1930. It is a double pen log barn with saddle and V notches built by Jim Hatcher. Hatcher later owned this Elijah Oliver property. It is located in Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Fred Proffitt House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1900. It has a two story frame and hip and gable roof. It is located at 127 Wilson Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Southern Railroad Freight Depot

mods.abstract: Structure was functional 1925-1989. It is the only early railroad building in county standing on original site. It is a frame freight depot. It is located at 406 S. Washington Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Commercial

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
ALCOA South Plant Office Building

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1940s. It is a three story brick with art deco trim. It is significant to the Aluminum Company's contribution to defense and war efforts in the 1940s. It is located at Hall Rd., Alcoa TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Limited use as office space

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Robert McNutt/W. B. Howard House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1900. It is two story frame house built in Victorian style with hip and gable roof and a two story front porch. It is located at 825 Broadway Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Southern Railroad Trestle

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1900. It is a steel railroad trestle on concrete footings. It is located l mile N of Rockford, off Hwy 33, on Little River Rd.,Rockford, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Southern Railroad; Current Use: Same

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
People's Bank of Friendsville

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1915. It is a bank built of brick. It was in business to 1936. Only significant commercial building remaining in Friendsville. It is located at College St., Friendsville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Clover Hill Mill

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1921. It was built on site of earlier mills. It was used to grind corn meal into the 1980's, and it was still grinding feed in 2005. It is located at Jct. Clover Hill Mill Rd. and Clover Hill Rd. Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Mill

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Kinzel Springs Swinging Bridge

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1900. It is a footbridge connecting parts of a resort in early 1900s. It was replaced in 1990s after it was destroyed by flood. It is located at Across Little River between Hwy 321 and Old Walland Hwy at Kinzel Springs, Walla.
mods.note: Ownership: Blount County; Current Use: Footbridge

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Webster House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1920. It is a two story frame house in Victorian style with hip and gable roof. It was relocated from nearby ca. 1920. It is located at 108 E. Goddard Ave, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Federal Building

mods.abstract: Structure was built in Colonial Revival style with brick. It is the first federal building constructed in county. It functioned as Main Post Office, 1917-1962, and a branch 1962-90. It was the first headquarters of Great Smoky Mountains National Park, 1935. It is located at 201 E. Broadway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Commercial

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Pflanze Building

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1868. It is a two story brick commercial building with Italianate influences, constructed by Charles Pflanze. It was originally a furniture and casket shop. The building later housed a Five and Dime, a movie theater, and a drug store. It is located at Broadway Ave., downtown Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Classic movies and live music are presented in the building which is restored to its 1934 look as the Palace Theater.

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Isaac Yearout House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1819-1824. It is two story, brick with side gables, hipped rear extension, and gabled two story front porch with columns. It is located at 1305 Big Springs Rd., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Dr. Royal Jennings House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1874. It is a two story frame with side gables, Italianate influences. It is located at 304 Indiana Avenue, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Bethel Baptist Church

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1800. It is a brick church with gable roof, squared towers, and gothic windows. It is located at Hall Rd. and Stephenson St., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Church

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
H. F. "Bert" Anderson Barn

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1917. It is a two level frame barn with gable roof. Structure was constructed with lumber from the family farm with interior wood silo. It is located at 4226 Old Knoxville Hwy, Rockford, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Barn

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Aluminum Company of America House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1920. It is a two story frame house with front and rear gables and interior central chimney. It is a typical "company house" built by ALCOA for supervisory personnel. It is located at 1431 Ramsay St., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John J. Craig Quarry Historic District

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1896. Structure is a marble quarry. They operated throughout much of the 20th century. It is located at Marmor Rd., 0.5 mi. S of Miser Station Rd., Friendsville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Not in operation

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Willard House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1891. It was designed by Beaver and Hoffmeister of Knoxville in Queen Anne style. It was built of red brick with red mortar. It was the residence of the college presidents, 1891-1951. It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Office and social space

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
White's Mill

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1842. It operated as a grist mill for about 100 years. It is one of the few remaining mills in the county. It is located at Old White's Mill Rd. Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Abandoned

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Victor J. Hultquist House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1925. It is one and one-half story brick with gable roof and two front dormers. Victor J. Hultquist was city manager of Alcoa from its incorporation in 1919 until 1948. Simultaneously, he was the Aluminum Company's Superintendent of Construction. It is located at 1533 Springbrook Rd. Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John Martin Mill

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1834. It was a mill and mill dam operating from 1834 to recent years. It is located at Mill Loop Rd., 0.3 mi. S of W. Millers Cove Rd., Walland, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Not in operation

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Henry Whitehead House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1895. It is a double pen log house. Front pen built by Henry Whitehead with sawn pine logs, half dovetail notches, with brick chimney. Rear pen built ca. 1873 by David Shields with hewn oak, poplar and pine logs, V notches, with stone chimney, and joining porch. It is located at Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Peter Brickey House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1808. It is a single pen log house with rear shed made with poplar logs with half dovetail notches. It is located at Wears Valley Rd, 0.l mi. W. of Bonner Hollow Rd., Townsend, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Unoccupied

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John Gillespie House

mods.abstract: Structure is a two story, three bay residence of limestone construction. It features jack arching with a dated stone (1802) on the lintel above the door. It has two chimneys and frame ell. It is located at Lowes Ferry Rd., l mi. N of Louisville,TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Unoccupied

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
David Jones House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1874. It is a two story, symmetrical plan with three bay brick Italianate design. It is a residence built with a one story ell and significant interior woodwork. Structure was a residence of skilled mason David Jones, Maryville mayor W. T. Parham, and Maryville College professor E. B. Waller. It is located at 404 High St., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Willard House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1880s. It is a two story frame, with hip and gable roof. It was a farm house which was developed as the Oak Park residential area. It is located at 1202 Oak Park Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John F. Shea House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1904. It is a two and one-half story frame house in Queen Anne style. It was built by Shea for George Townsend. George was brother to W. B. Townsend who was President of Little River Railroad and Lumber Company. It is located at 7713 River Rd., Townsend.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Arthur Kennedy House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1850. It is a two story frame house with rear ell, gable roof, and Greek Revival features in porches. It is located at Cox Rd., Louisville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
John Oliver House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1850. It is one and one-half story log house with single pen with half dovetail notches. It is located at Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Preacher William H. Oliver or Carter Shields House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1876. It is a pen log house, one and one half story, built of pine logs with dovetail notches. It was purchased in 1910 by Carter Shields. It is located at Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Bartlett Hall

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1901. It was built as a campus YMCA building. It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Restored and renovated in 2001 as a student services building

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
King House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1910. It is one and one-half stories with gambrel roof and dormers. It is located at 225 S. Magnolia Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
C. L. Babcock House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1916-1917. It is a two story frame with hip roof, front dormers, and porch. It was originally occupied by C. L. Babcock, founder of Babcock Lumber and Land Company. The company built saw and finishing mills, employee housing, a store, clubhouse, and school then called "North Maryville." It is located at 856 Poplar St., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Bethlehem Methodist Church

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1886. It is a Gothic Revival wooden building. It is located at Bethlehem Rd., 0.5 mi. S of Ellejoy Rd., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Opened by Bethlehem Cemetery Association, on request, for weddings, homecomings, etc.

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Pete Hood House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1910. It is a Craftsman style frame with stone water tower on grounds. It is located at 827 W. Broadway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Davis House

mods.abstract: Structure built in approximately 1900. It is a three story frame with hip and gable roof with brick chimney. It is located at 1018 Oak Park Ave., Maryville, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Springbrook School Gymnasium

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1921. It is a brick gymnasium with arched windows. It became a recreation center after a new elementary school was built in 1971. It is located at Faraday Street.
mods.note: Ownership: City; Current Use: Recreation center

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Warner Martin House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1793. It is a two story frame house built as a single cell. It was enlarged to a five bay I-House design from timber frame construction. It is the oldest intact example of timber frame construct. It is located at 4350 Nails Creek Rd., Rockford, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private;

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
The Old Oaken Bucket

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1930. It is a typical service station of the era. It is located at Old Knoxville Hwy, 4 mi. N of Rockford Rockford, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Engine repair shop

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Rockford Manufacturing Company House

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1920. It is a one story frame house with front and rear gables and is typical of a company house in a cotton mill town in the 1920s. It is located at Rockford, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Nicholson House or "Millennium Manor"

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1937. It is a one story house of pink marble with basement and arched and hip roof. Built by William Andrew Nicholson, by hand, from 1937 to 1946, "to survive Armageddon and enjoy the millennium to follow." It is located at Corner Wright Rd. and Harding St., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Unoccupied

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
A. J. Fisher House

mods.abstract: Structure built ca. 1905. It is one of few significant and unaltered resources related to the operation of Schlosser Leather Company. A. J. "Jack" Fisher, works manager, lived in this one story frame house. It is located at Old Walland Hwy, Walland, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Pearsons Hall

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1910. It was designed by George Barber in Colonial Revival style built of brick. It features a double high Ionic colonnade. It was first campus building to include steel supports and to have indoor plumbing. It is located at 502 E. Lamar Alexander Parkway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Student residence hall and campus cafeteria

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
James Henry House

mods.abstract: Structure built between 1833 and 1835. It is a two story, five bay notable brick residence with side gables, chimneys, and rear ell. It is located at 305 Henry Lane, Greenback, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Springbrook Pool

mods.abstract: Structure built around 1931. Parks and recreational facilities were an important part of the city's plan. It is located at Vose Rd., Alcoa, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: City; Current Use: Swimming pool

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Friends Church

mods.abstract: Structure is a Colonial Revival style, brick with tile roof. It was a Quaker meeting house, 1871-1936. It is located at 314 W. Broadway, Maryville, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Since 1947, St. Andrew's Episcopal Church

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Cades Cove Methodist Church

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1902. It is a one room frame church with front and rear gables, two front doors, and interior divider (women and children on left, men on right). Structure was built by the minister, J. D. McCampbell, to replace earlier log structure. It is located at Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum, with occasional use as a church

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Schlosser Leather Company House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1905. It is a one story "T" shaped frame house with gable roof built by Schlosser Leather Company to house family of a workers. It is located at East Millers Cove Rd, Walland, TN.
mods.note: Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
Porter/Brakebill House

mods.abstract: Structure built in 1856. It is a frame, central passage plan, I-House with Greek Revival detailing. It is one of Blount County's few houses located on a prosperous farm in fertile bottom lands along Little River. It is located at Martin Mill Pike, Rockford, TN.
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Register of Historic Places.
Ownership: Private; Current Use: Residence

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
